text: The Turkish alphabet is used for writing, speaking and reading in Turkish. This alphabet is modified from the Latin alphabet. There are 29 letters in the Turkish alphabet. The English letters Q, W and X are not in the Turkish alphabet. Seven letters that have been changed from their original Latin forms (Ç, Ğ, I, İ, Ö, Ş, and Ü) are in the Turkish alphabet. Capital letters A B C Ç D E F G Ğ H I İ J K L M N O Ö P R S Ş T U Ü V Y Z Lower case letters a b c ç d e f g ğ h ı i j k l m n o ö p r s ş t u ü v y z There are 8 vowels in the Turkish alphabet: A, E, I, İ, O, Ö, U, Ü. There are 21 consonants in the Turkish alphabet: B, C, Ç, D, F, G, Ğ, H, J, K, L, M, N, P, R, S, Ş, T, V, Y, Z. ==Letters== Letter Letter IPA Name English approximation Letter Letter IPA Name English approximation A a a As a in father M m me As m in man B b be As b in bat N n ne As n in no C c ce As j in job O o o As o in not Ç ç çe As ch in chat Ö ö ö As u in fur D d de As d in dog P p pe As p in put E e e As e in red R r re As r in rent F f fe As f in far S s se As s in sand G g or ge As g in gap Ş ş şe As sh in she Ğ ğ yumuşak ge T t te As t in top H h he As h in hot U u u As oo in moose I ı ı Like a in about Ü ü ü As u in lute İ i i As i in machine V v ve As v in valve J j je As g in montage Y y ye As y in you K k or ke As c in cat Z z ze As z in zip L l or le As l in let Additionally, I (Latin I), Q, W, and X are not in the Turkish alphabet, but they are used in loanwords. Category:Alphabets Category:Turkey alphabet
title: Turkish alphabet
